definition: to excavate/to dig out/fig. to investigate (in an archive)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: He demonstrates a unique theme exploration and language adaptaion in the creation of English poems.
sentences.chinese: 他在詩歌創作中表現出獨特的主題開掘和語言變異。

sentences.english: Canals have been built to take water to the desert.
sentences.chinese: 開掘渠道把水引進沙漠。

sentences.english: Using horses and manpower, the canal was dug across the state.
sentences.chinese: 運河的開掘主要依靠人力和畜力。

sentences.english: And through soul-awakening, students' free spirit can be explored comprehensively.
sentences.chinese: 通過心靈喚醒，可以促進學生自由精神的全面開掘。

sentences.english: These are the questions that the present paper intends to focus on and to answer.
sentences.chinese: 此乃本文擬將開掘和闡釋的論旨所在。

sentences.english: The " looking back" literature and art emphasized the digging of humanity and the innovation of the style of art.
